business.headline: Amazon, Flipkart and major smartphone brands face antitrust heat: ReportThe Competition Commission of India (CCI) has found that these companies have been involved in exclusive product launches on their platforms, which may have restricted competition and harmed smaller businesses.

Rent vs buy: What's the smarter financial move for you?Renting offers the freedom to move, explore career opportunities, and invest in other ventures. Buying a home, on the other hand, offers long-term security, a sense of ownership, and equity building.

Centre approves Madhya Pradesh's request for soybean procurement at MSPUnion Agriculture and Farmer Welfare Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan confirmed that the proposal from the Madhya Pradesh government was received and approved late Tuesday.

Centre lifts minimum export price cap on onion, basmati riceThe $950 per tonne minimum export price for basmati rice has been removed while the export duty on onion has been cut to 20 per cent from 40 per cent, in effect from September 14.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Will it double investors' wealth on market debut?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO listing: With the GMP indicating a significant upside, all eyes are now on whether the shares will live up to the hype and deliver the bumper listing gains many expect.

Trump allies plan to privatise Fannie and Freddie, says reportThe discussions involve prominent figures close to Trump, including Larry Kudlow, the former director of the National Economic Council, and John McEntee, who previously worked in the White House.

Sebi chief addresses conflict of interest allegations with 3 big clarificationsThe Buchs firmly denied any wrongdoing, offering detailed explanations to counter allegations tied to consulting roles, rental income, and Madhabi Puri Buch's ICICI Bank stock options.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as markets take breather after strong rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 135.83 points to 82,926.88, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 43 points lower at 25,345.90.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Cash in on listing day or wait for long-term gain? Brokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.

Sebi chief, husband reject conflict of interest charges, call it false, motivatedIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv shares gain amid housing unit IPO buzzThe buzz around the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, which is set to make its stock market debut on September 16, has led traders on Dalal Street to snap up shares of other publicly traded Bajaj companies, hoping to capitalise on the momentum.

Western Carriers IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe or skip? Western Carriers (India) Limited has allocated 85,96,743 equity shares to 15 anchor investors, raising Rs 148 crore before its proposed IPO.
SpiceJet shares surge 9%: What's fuelling the rally and will it continue?SpiceJet share price: Despite regulatory challenges, the airline's shares have surged recently. Will the rally hold?

PN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusPN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: If you've applied for the IPO, you can check the allotment status online in a few simple steps through the websites of the BSE and Bigshare Services.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Got allotment? Check expected listing gainsBrokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.
Adani Group shares drop after Hindenburg's fresh allegationsHindenburg Research claimed that Swiss authorities had frozen over $310 million across several Swiss bank accounts.
Sensex, Nifty pause rally near record highs; Bajaj twins gainThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 134.05 points to 82,828.66 at 10:28 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 44.30 points to 25,344.60.

Adani Group rejects Hindenburg claim of Swiss banks' $310 million funds freezeHindenburg cited a Swiss media outlet, Gotham City, which alleged that more than $310 million belonging to an alleged frontman for billionaire Gautam Adani is sequestered in six Swiss banks. The Adani Group "unequivocally" rejected the claim.

Amazon, Flipkart found violating Indian competition laws: ReportA probe by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart engaged in anti-competitive practices by favouring select sellers on their platforms.

Understanding circle rates: A simple guide for homebuyers and sellersUnderstanding the concept of circle rates, and how they influence property valuations, has become critical for anyone navigating the real estate market.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Congress's Sam Pitroda calls India Today reporter to apologise for assault in USIn a personal call, Indian Overseas Congress chairman, Sam Pitroda, expressed his deep disappointment over the 'unfortunate' incident and assured a thorough investigation into the matter.

What Arvind Kejriwal's surprise resignation announcement means for AAPDelhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal made a surprising announcement to resign from his post in the next two days, giving rise to uncertainty over the political scenario in the national capital.

Union Minister calls Rahul Gandhi 'No. 1 terrorist' over remarks on SikhsUnion Minister Ravneet Singh Bittu launched a scathing attack on Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over his remarks on Sikhs in India, calling him the "number one terrorist of the country" and "claiming that he was not an Indian".

Post-Hasina Bangladesh gravitates towards Urdu and JinnahBangladesh, then East Pakistan, saw the Bangla language movement in 1952 against the imposition of Urdu by Pakistan. Five people who gave their lives are honoured as martyrs. But in post-Hasina Bangladesh, Mohammad Ali Jinnah's anniversary of death is being marked with Urdu poetry and songs.

Video: Drone footage shows final assault on hiding terrorists in J&KThree terrorists were killed in an encounter with the Indian Army in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla on Saturday. In a video of the encounter in Baramulla's Kreeri, captured on drone, one of the three terrorists can be seen running out of the building in a bid to escape. However, security personnel opened fire on him, following which he was shot dead.

Woman sleeping next to ailing son at Kolkata hospital molested, accused arrestedA health worker was arrested for allegedly molesting a woman at a government-run hospital in Kolkata, while she was sleeping with her ailing son.

Sam Pitroda a nice guy, was shocked at my assault: India Today reporterThe chief of Indian Overseas Congress Sam Pitroda apologised to India Today journalist Rohit Sharma after a recent incident in the United States, where members of Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi's team were involved in an attack on Sharma.

How did Arvind Kejriwal arrive at decision to step down? AAP insiders explainArvind Kejriwal made the decision to quit as Delhi Chief Minister while he was in jail for his alleged involvement in the liquor policy case, AAP sources said.

Clothes fall, cameras roll: Intimacy coordinators make reel sex realistic, safeThe film industry is finding that it needs intimacy coordinators to shoot sex scenes as it requires stunt directors for action sequences. Intimacy coordinators tell us how they help make bedroom sequences as realistic as possible while taking care of the actors' safety and comfort. They also reveal the contents of their toolbox.

Neeraj Chopra reveals he competed in Diamond League Final with broken handStar javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has revealed that he competed in the Diamond League Final in Brussels with a broken hand. Neeraj took to Twitter to reveal an X-ray of his palm and said that he aims to return stronger next season.

BJP mocks Arvind Kejriwal's resignation announcement, Congress calls it gimmickBJP national spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari called Arvind Kejriwal's move a "PR stunt" and said the AAP supremo recognises that his image among Delhiites has shifted from being an honest leader to one associated with corruption.

Rent vs buy: What's the smarter financial move for you?Renting offers the freedom to move, explore career opportunities, and invest in other ventures. Buying a home, on the other hand, offers long-term security, a sense of ownership, and equity building.

Salman Khan visits Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's house for Ganpati darshanBollywood superstar Salman Khan visited Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's house to perform Ganesh puja. The politician shared pictures from the intimate celebration.

Tamil fishermen released by Sri Lankan Navy claim torture, head shavingThe eight fishermen were arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy for allegedly crossing the maritime border on August 29. Their boat was also seized.

Hemant Soren's party swayed by Congress, has ties with infiltrators: PMPM Modi accused the JMM of aligning with "Bangladeshi and Rohingya infiltrators," claiming that these "fundamentalists" are increasingly influencing the party.

Protesting doctors on Mamata Banerjee's tea offer: Only if justice is servedOn Saturday evening, despite the Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's offer for tea, the protesting doctors vowed to continue their protests until their demand for justice in the rape and murder of the trainee doctor is fulfilled.
Deepika Padukone changes Instagram bio after welcoming baby girlDeepika Padukone updated her Instagram bio after childbirth. She shared a cute update about her baby girl.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Anil Vij bids for Haryana Chief Minister's post: I am senior-most BJP leaderAddressing the media, senior BJP leader and six-time MLA Anil Vij said that he never sought anything from the party, but this time, based on his seniority, he will stake claim on the chief minister's post.

Polaris Dawn astronauts return safely after historic five-day space missionThe crew, led by billionaire philanthropist Jared Isaacman, included mission pilot Scott "Kidd" Poteet and mission specialists Anna Menon and Sarah Gillis. (Photo: SpaceX)

Esha Deol opens up about period restrictions at homeEsha Deol recently spoke candidly about the limitations placed on women during menstruation in her household. She revealed that women are not permitted to visit temples while menstruating.

Man dies after SUV rams his bike in Mumbai, driver on the runA man was killed while another injured after a speeding car hit a motorcycle in Mumbai's Dahisar. The incident occurred on September 13 around 4 pm, according to Dahisar Police.

Prashant Kishor vows to end Bihar liquor ban within an hour if electedAhead of the launch of his political party, Jan Suraaj, Prashant Kishor pledged to scrap the ban on liquor in Bihar, saying that it led to illegal home deliveries of alcohol and deprived the state of Rs 20,000 crore in excise revenue.

Mumbai-Doha IndiGo flight cancelled after 5-hour delay, passengers strandedAn IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Doha was cancelled after a five-hour delay, leaving passengers stranded at the airport. IndiGo has assured that affected passengers will be accommodated on subsequent flights and provided with necessary assistance.

Kudali Bhagya actor Shraddha Arya announces pregnancyTV actor Shraddha Arya announced her pregnancy on Sunday, September 15 with an adorable video. The actor, renowned for her TV soap Kundali Bhagya, is married to naval officer Rahul Nagpal.

Saif Ali Khan reveals whether his character dies in Devara Part 1In a recent interview, Sandeep Reddy Vanga sought insights from Saif Ali Khan regarding his character in Devara: Part 1. The film, also starring Jr NTR and Janhvi Kapoor, is set to hit theatres on September 27.

Varun Sood says working in Jug Jugg Jeeyo was 'life-changing'Varun Sood spoke about his transformative experience in Jug Jugg Jeeyo, marking his transition from TV to Bollywood. The actor was a part of Call Me Bae.

Salman Khan visits Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's house for Ganpati darshanBollywood superstar Salman Khan visited Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's house to perform Ganesh puja. The politician shared pictures from the intimate celebration.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli breaks Chepauk wall during practice session in ChennaiSenior India batter Virat Kohli broke a part of the wall in Chepak during the practice session on Sunday, September 15. One of Kohli's shots crashed into the wall near the dressing rooms.

India vs Korea, Asian Champions Trophy semi-final: All you need to knowIndia will face Korea in the Asian Champions Trophy semi-final on September 16, aiming to maintain their unbeaten run. Defending champions India have dominated throughout the tournament, while Korea, fueled by a confident draw, seeks redemption.

Jos Buttler ruled out of Australia ODIs, Harry Brook named captain    ENG vs AUS: Harry Brook will lead the England ODI squad for their upcoming series against Australia after Jos Buttler was ruled out due to a calf injury.

Veteran Shams Mulani credits experience behind all-round show in Duleep TrophyIndia A beat India D in the second round of the Duleep Trophy on Sunday, September 15. Shams Mulani was named the player of the match for his all-round show with bat and ball.

Inspired by daughter, Saleema Imtiaz breaks new ground in Pakistan cricketPakistan cricketer Kainat Imtiaz's mother Saleema became the first Pakistani female umpire to be included in the ICC International Development Panel of Umpires.

Many of the fans were not even born in 1969: Nottingham coach after Anfield winNottingham Forest manager Nuno Espirito Santo said that he was proud of the team's victory against Liverpool. Forest beat Liverpool at Anfield for the first time in 55 years.

Giorgio Chiellini returns to home club Juventus in new executive roleGiorgio Chiellini's return to Juventus as Head of Football Institutional Relations has sparked excitement among fans, bringing his leadership and legacy back to the club where he spent 17 years as a player and won numerous titles.

Pakistan vs South Africa Women's T20I series: All you need to knowPAK vs SA: Pakistan and South Africa will be up against each other in a 3-match T20I series, starting September 16 at the Multan Cricket Stadium.

Saleema Imtiaz 1st Pakistan woman to be nominated as international umpireSaleema Imtiaz became the first woman umpire from Pakistan to be nominated to the ICC international panel of development umpires, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said on Sunday.

Mbappe shuts Vinicius fued talks: He is a great playerKylian Mbappe praised Vinicius Jr after Real Madrid's 2-0 win against Real Sociedad, dismissing any rumors of a feud between them. Both stars scored penalties, with Mbappe highlighting the team's focus on winning over individual accolades.

Ricky Bhui leads India D's fight with gutsy hundred Ricky Bhui showcased remarkable skill and resilience with a century on Day 4 of the Duleep Trophy match against India A, anchoring the innings despite wickets falling around him.

Shanto wary of India challenge but delighted to take 'extra confidence' forwardBangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto is wary of India's strength ahead of the two-match Test series but is happy to take extra confidence forward after beating Pakistan in a historic series.

Sancho just needs some love: Chelsea boss Maresca after winger's big debutJadon Sancho impressed on his Chelsea debut, assisting the winning goal against Bournemouth. Boss Enzo Maresca praised the winger's performance, predicting more brilliance ahead as Sancho settles into his new role following his loan from Manchester United.

Shubman Gill set to be rested for T20I series vs BangladeshIndia vice-captain Shubman Gill is likely to be rested for the upcoming three-match T20I series against Bangladesh starting October 7, following BCCI's workload management policy. Several other key players will also be rested to prepare for the three-Test series against New Zealand scheduled for later in October.

Emery admits selection headache after Aston Villa's 3-2 win over EvertonAston Villa manager Unai Emery admits facing a challenge in managing his striking options after a thrilling 3-2 comeback win against Everton. Jhon Duran and Ollie Watkins both impressed, creating a selection headache for the manager.

People advised me to commit suicide: Navdeep Singh recalls harrowing pastIndia's Navdeep Singh recently recalled how he used society's harsh words as motivation to face the hardships of life. Navdeep revealed how people advised him to commit suicide.

R Ashwin reveals his retirement plans ahead of Bangladesh TestsIndia vs Bangladesh: Ace Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has spoken about his future in international cricket, stating that his retirement will come when he no longer feels the drive to improve his game.

Aakash Chopra recalls how MS Dhoni's audacious shot left him stunned in 2004Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra recently recalled how MS Dhoni left him stunned with his batting during an India A tour in 2004.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
